title: Blinken blasts Putin's 'utter contempt and disdain' for UN
Blinken blasts Putin's 'utter contempt and disdain' for UN
Will interest rate hikes throw the US into a recession?
description: The Federal Reserve is expected to make history by raising interest rates 0.75% for a third time in a row.  CNN's Brian Todd breaks down how this will impact Americans.

title: Special master questions Trump's claims about Mar-a-Lago docs being declassified
CNN gets access to Ukrainian town under constant shelling
description: CNN International Security Editor Nick Paton Walsh got access to an eastern Ukrainian town under constant shelling as Russia, desperate for soldiers, recruits convicted felons to their ranks.

title: Watch Tim McGraw's slick recovery after falling from stage at festival
description: Country music icon Tim McGraw turned an onstage accident into a special moment greeting fans while performing at a music festival in Arizona.

title: 'SNL' announces first three guest hosts of the season
description: Live from New York... you know the drill.

title: Finnish President calls for 'solidarity' in face of Russia's war and its global threat at UN
Special master questions Trump's claims about Mar-a-Lago docs being declassified
description: Judge Raymond Dearie, the special master overseeing the seizure of documents from Mar-a-Lago, signaled on Tuesday to lawyers for former President Donald Trump that if they don't make a case that any of the documents were declassified, he would determine that they're classified.

title: 'Avatar' soars back into theaters
description: One of the biggest movies of all time returns to theaters ahead of its long-awaited sequel which arrives later this year. Rick Damigella reports.

title: See late night reactions to President Biden claiming pandemic over
description: Late night hosts unleashed numerous jokes after President Joe Biden announced the Covid-19 pandemic had ended during a "60 Minutes" interview.

title: Scientists have estimated how many ants there are on Earth. Clue: It's a lot
description: Ants are tiny in size but not in number. There are about 20 quadrillion ants on the Earth at any given time, a new study has estimated. That's 20,000 trillion individuals.

title: Space Force releases official song 'Semper Supra'
description: The US Space Force released its official song, titled "Semper Supra," on Tuesday.

title: Russian parliament toughens punishment for violation of military service duties
American Airlines to introduce premium suites with privacy doors
description: Privacy doors and lie-flat seats with a chaise lounge option are features of the new premium suites American Airlines plans to roll out on its long-haul fleet.

title: Beyond Meat executive arrested on suspicion of biting a man's nose
description: The chief operating officer of vegan food purveyor Beyond Meat was arrested over the weekend after allegedly biting a man's nose during a fight following an Arkansas football game.

title: 'Like a scary movie': Otter takes surfer's board
description: A Santa Cruz, California, surfer has his ride cut short when an otter hops on his board and refuses to give it up. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports.

title: US and Canadian warships sail through Taiwan Strait after Biden vows to defend island
description: US and Canadian warships sailed through the Taiwan Strait on Tuesday following weekend remarks from President Joe Biden that the US would defend Taiwan in the event it is attacked by China.

title: Judge blocks execution by lethal injection of Alabama death row inmate
description: A federal judge has granted an order prohibiting Alabama from executing a death row inmate by lethal injection this week after he asserted he chose to die by nitrogen hypoxia -- an untested and unproven execution method Alabama officials say they're not ready to use.

title: Trump asks appeals court to keep criminal probe into Mar-a-Lago documents on hold
description: Former President Donald Trump on Tuesday told the 11th US Circuit Court of Appeals that it should not lift the hold a lower court judge put on the Justice Department using Mar-a-Lago documents identified as classified in its criminal probe.

title: Adam Levine denies having an affair, but admits he 'crossed the line'
description: Following allegations that he cheated on wife Behati Prinsloo and wanted to name their child after his alleged mistress, Adam Levine is speaking out.

title: Apple plans fix for bug that users say makes iPhone 14 Pro camera shake uncontrollably
description: Apple said it is working on a software fix after some users who recently purchased an iPhone 14 Pro or iPhone 14 Pro Max reported their devices' rear-facing cameras shook "uncontrollably" and made strange noises when using social media apps.

title: Oops! Honda overpaid their workers in bonuses and now they want it back
description: A Honda motor vehicle plant in Ohio told its workers that they have to pay back some of their bonus after overpaying them. HLN's Jennifer Westhoven has the story.

title: Drinking at least 4 cups of certain teas may reduce type 2 diabetes risk, research finds
description: Drinking black, green or oolong tea might have more benefits than a little energy boost -- a certain amount could reduce risk of developing type 2 diabetes, new research has found.

title: The world is moving backward in the combat against poverty and disease. Here's what we need to do
description: The first two decades of the 21st century provided more progress for more people than perhaps any other period in human history. Deaths from malaria, HIV and tuberculosis were cut in half. Child deaths fell dramatically. Polio was nearly eradicated. And the global poverty rate fell by nearly three-quarters.

title: Drug overdose death rates highest among American Indian people and middle-age Black men, study shows
description: Drug overdose deaths in the United States increased sharply throughout the Covid-19 pandemic, reaching record levels in 2021. But the burden on different racial and ethnic groups has changed, according to a study by federal researchers published Tuesday in JAMA Network Open.

title: Farmer uncovers stunning Byzantine-era mosaic in Gaza orchard
description: An ornate Byzantine floor mosaic showing a variety of colorful birds and other animals has been discovered by chance in Gaza after a Palestinian farmer tried to plant new trees on his land.

title: Video: Protesters remove head scarves in protest over woman's death in police custody
description: CNN international correspondent Jomana Karadsheh reports on the deadly protests in Tehran, Iran after a 22-year-old Iranian woman died after being arrested by Iran's morality police.

title: Matthew McConaughey shares what his parents taught him about consent
description: Matthew McConaughey says his father helped teach him about the concept of consent.

title: Selma Blair stuns in 'Dancing with the Stars' debut
description: "Dancing with the Stars" kicked off season 31 on Disney+. Watch actress Selma Blair's stunning performance and "Real Housewives" star Teresa Giudice flip a table.

title: Camila Cabello makes coaching debut on 'The Voice'
description: Camila Cabello is turning her chair as the newest coach on "The Voice."

title: Bad Bunny leads the nominations for Latin Grammys
description: The nominees for the 23rd Latin Grammy Awards were revealed Tuesday, and Bad Bunny capped off his hot summer.

title: EU approves additional 5 billion dollars to assist Ukraine
Russia's invasion of Ukraine expected to be key issue in UN General Assembly
Ukraine says referendum plans in Russian-occupied areas stem from 'fear of defeat'
Magnus Carlsen quits match without explanation amid apparent feud with fellow grandmaster Hans Niemann
description: Shortly after making his first move, world champion Magnus Carlsen resigned from an online chess match against fellow grandmaster Hans Niemann on Monday.

title: Donald Trump is (still) very unpopular
description: The revived political hopes of Democrats heading into the midterm election are due, in no small part, to this fundamental political reality: Donald Trump is very, very unpopular.

title: 'Love Is Blind' stars Deepti and Kyle no longer together
description: Well, that didn't last very long.

title: US Presidents were always 'beguiled by the Queen' says former White House Correspondent
description: New York Times London bureau chief Mark Landler talks to Christiane Amanpour about the impact of the Queen on UK-US relations and how King Charles III will deal with the same challenges.

title: Tax fossil fuel companies 'feasting' on profits as 'planet burns' and power bills soar, UN chief urges
description: Rich economies should hit oil and gas companies with new windfall taxes to provide help for countries suffering from climate change, and people struggling with soaring energy and food bills, UN Secretary General António Guterres said Tuesday.

title: Lawmaker predicts likely next step for Putin in Ukraine
description: CNN's Brianna Keilar asks Sen. Angus King (I-ME) about the specific weapons the US is providing to Ukrainian forces and the paradox of their success against Russian President Vladimir Putin.

title: Elton John will perform at White House on Friday
description: Singer Elton John will perform at the White House Friday night, according to a release from the White House.

title: BMW shows off new electric racer that may never be produced
description: BMW unveils an all-electric, off-road racing prototype called "Dune Taxi." However, the company says this one-off project may never be produced or entered into competition.

title: As many as 45,000 Fords can't be sold because they're missing parts
description: The still-clogged global supply chain continues to wreak havoc on the auto industry.

title: Here's why tech companies keep paying millions to settle lawsuits in Illinois
description: Regulators have spent years trying to make big tech companies pay for the ways they harvest and, at times, abuse users' data. One state, meanwhile, is literally making them pay up — and pay out directly to consumers.

title: '60-ton beast': Ret. General describes tank US is looking to send to Ukraine
description: A senior military official says US tanks are on the table to send to Ukraine. Brig. Gen. Steve Anderson (Ret.) explains why he thinks the US should continue meeting Ukraine's requirements and whether the country should put contractors on the ground to help with logistics.

title: Doctor warns against cooking chicken in NyQuil trend
description: The Food and Drug Administration has issued a warning against a TikTok trend of kids cooking chicken with NyQuil. CNN medical correspondent Dr. Tara Narula talks about the dangers of following this trend.

title: Anxious investors are piling into hedge funds
description: For years, the climate for hedge funds was tough. Volatility was low. The price of everything was going up. It wasn't that hard to make money. In that type of environment, why think outside the box?

title: Deforestation is accelerating in Brazil as Bolsonaro's first term ends, experts say
description: Illegal activity in the Amazon is gaining momentum as the last months of Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro's administration wind down, experts tell CNN.

title: 'Reboot' pitches a knowing look at sitcom revivals and Hollywood insecurities
description: The meta aspects of a Hulu comedy about the making of a Hulu comedy quickly pile up in "Reboot," a fictional show about reviving a series from the early 2000s, reuniting the cast and crew with all their insecurities and old grudges. Created by "Modern Family's" Steve Levitan, it's a breezy and very-inside look at Hollywood, with a few too many rim shots but still a fair amount of laughs.

title: Five people killed in Iran in protests over death of woman in police custody, human rights group says
description: Five people have been killed by Iranian security forces during protests that were sparked by the death of Mahsa Amini, who was being held in police custody, according to a human rights monitor.

title: DeSantis' migrant flights point toward an ominous future of red and blue conflict
description: The spreading push from Republican governors to relocate undocumented immigrants into blue enclaves marks a new escalation of the red state drive to seize control of national policy from below, not only on immigration but on a broad array of domestic policies.

title: Arizona judge to rule on law that would ban nearly all abortions in the state
description: An Arizona Superior Court judge could rule as early as Tuesday on whether a 1901 ban on nearly all abortions in that state can be enforced, a court case that has created confusion about the current law in Arizona and could energize female voters to turn out in greater numbers in the state's hotly contested US Senate and governors races.

title: These male politicians are pushing for women who receive abortions to be punished with prison time
description: A businessman turned state representative from rural Oil City, Louisiana, and a Baptist pastor banded together earlier this year on a radical mission.

title: Don't cook chicken in NyQuil: FDA warns about dangerous social media challenges
description: Want to cook chicken in NyQuil? Overdose on antihistamines? Swallow laundry detergent pods?

title: How HSBC's wealth chief suggests you protect your portfolio from inflation
description: People around the world are searching for ways to shield themselves from the impact of stubbornly high inflation, and the rich are no exception.

title: Russia escalates attacks on civilian infrastructure
Ukrainian forces look to push counteroffensive farther east as military official warns: 'There will be a hard fight for every centimeter'
Norway's $1.2 trillion fund sets 2050 net zero target
description: Norway's $1.2 trillion wealth fund, the world's largest, said on Tuesday it would decarbonise its holdings by pushing firms to cut their greenhouse gas emissions to nil by 2050, in line with the Paris Agreement.

title: The Supreme Court can't escape the 2020 presidential race and is already involved in 2024 politics
description: An obscure legal theory promoted by allies of former President Donald Trump during the effort to overturn the 2020 presidential election will soon have its day before the Supreme Court.

title: Denmark and Germany now building the world's longest immersed tunnel
description: Descending up to 40 meters beneath the Baltic Sea, the world's longest immersed tunnel will link Denmark and Germany, slashing journey times between the two countries when it opens in 2029.

title: Video shows officials march residents off to quarantine camps in Tibet
description: A deadly bus crash in southwestern China has triggered outrage at the country's relentless zero-Covid policy.  The bus was carrying 47 people from Guiyang city to a remote county 155 miles (249 kilometers) away, when it overturned and rolled into a ditch, killing 27 people. CNN's Ivan Watson has more.

title: More than 1 million were left without running water after Hurricane Fiona ripped through the Dominican Republic. It's only expected to get stronger
description: Hurricane Fiona is continuing its ruinous path Tuesday after devastating Puerto Rico with flooding rain then ripping through the Dominican Republic, where more than a million people were left without running water and dozens of homes were destroyed.

title: Angelina Jolie to visit flood-ravaged Pakistan as government warns of humanitarian disaster
description: Angelina Jolie is set to visit flood-ravaged Pakistan, the International Rescue Committee (IRC) said in a statement Monday, in a trip intended to draw international attention to the country's unfolding humanitarian crisis.

title: Ukrainian forces look to push counteroffensive farther east as military official warns: 'There will be a hard fight for every centimeter'
Ukrainian forces liberate village in Luhansk region, official says, as counteroffensive pushes east
In 2017 Hurricane Maria devastated Puerto Rico. See why some say Fiona is worse
description: CNN's Leyla Santiago speaks to residents in San Juan, Puerto Rico, as Hurricane Fiona causes widespread flooding and loss of power.

title: Ukrainian forces look to push counteroffensive farther east as military official warns: 'There will be a hard fight for every centimeter'
Las Vegas police investigating incident in which fan allegedly struck an NFL player
description: Authorities in Las Vegas are investigating after a fan at a game between the Arizona Cardinals and the Las Vegas Raiders allegedly hit an NFL player.

title: White House surges aid to hurricane-hit Puerto Rico on a haunting five-year anniversary
description:
• Massive power outages cripple Puerto Rico
• Typhoon brings record rains to Japan

title: Footage confirms fake Trump elector was at Georgia elections office day it was breached
description: A Republican county official in Georgia and operatives working with an attorney for former President Donald Trump spent hours inside a restricted area of the local elections office on the day voting systems there were breached, newly obtained surveillance video shows.

title: Maybe Biden means it on Taiwan
description: The first time a president repudiates a critical foreign policy principle, it might seem like an accident. If it happens four times, it seems like he means it.

title: Brad Pitt makes his debut as a sculptor in Finland exhibition
description: Brad Pitt has made his debut as a sculptor, in a group show at the Sara Hildén Art Museum in Tampere, Finland. The A-List actor's artworks appear alongside those by the musician Nick Cave and the artist Thomas Houseago for the exhibition "We," on view until January 15, 2023.

title: Texas sheriff investigating how migrants went from state to Martha's Vineyard
Texas sheriff to investigate transportation of migrants from state to Martha's Vineyard
description: A Texas sheriff said Monday evening his agency will open an investigation into the transportation of 48 Venezuelan migrants from the state to Martha's Vineyard, Massachusetts.

title: See the troubles Ukrainians face after liberation from Russian forces
description: No running water and electricity are some of the hardships residents in the newly liberated city of Izium, Ukraine, face after being occupied by Russian forces. CNN's Ben Wedeman reports.

title: The challenges of building a sustainable resort in the lowest-lying country in the world
description: Many architects would kill to be given a blank slate on which to create their dream project.

title: Amanda Gorman recites excerpt of new poem live on CNN
description: Amanda Gorman debuted a new poem at the United Nations focusing on global challenges including poverty and hunger. The poet and author joined CNN's Anderson Cooper to share her poetic process and even recited an excerpt live.

title: Myanmar army helicopters fire on school, killing six
description: At least six children were killed and 17 wounded when army helicopters shot at a school in Myanmar, media reports and residents said on Monday, as the military said it opened fire because rebels were using the building to attack its forces.

title: Kalani David, professional surfer and skateboarder, dies after seizure while surfing
description: Kalani David, a Hawaiian-born professional surfer and skateboarder, died after he suffered a seizure while surfing off Costa Rica on Saturday, according to his father, David David.

title: Post Malone falls through hole on stage during performance
description: Rapper Post Malone finished his concert in St. Louis despite bruising multiple ribs.

title: Britain bids farewell to Queen Elizabeth with an outpouring of emotion
Trump team says it doesn't want to immediately disclose certain 'declassification' information in special master review
description: Lawyers for former President Donald Trump signaled Monday that they oppose having to immediately make disclosures about declassification related to the Mar-a-Lago documents as part of the special master process ordered by a federal judge this month.

title: Night owls have higher risk of type 2 diabetes, heart disease, study says
description: If you prefer to go to bed and get up later -- a sleep chronotype known as being a night owl -- you may be at higher risk for type 2 diabetes and heart disease, a new study found.
